meanings.definition: The act of cleaning out or removing unwanted items or debris from a space.
meanings.sent1: After the party, we did the cleanouts to clear the empty cups and plates.
meanings.sent2: The cleanouts of the garage revealed many forgotten treasures.
meanings.sent3: During the cleanouts, we found a sock that seemed to have vanished into thin air.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the house during the cleanouts, making the task more enjoyable.
meanings.sent5: The cleanouts of the attic felt like uncovering buried secrets.

meanings.definition: A pipe or opening used to remove waste or excess material from a system.
meanings.sent1: The plumber fixed the cleanouts to prevent any blockages in the drainage system.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to check the cleanouts regularly to avoid any plumbing issues.
meanings.sent3: The cleanouts were like the gatekeepers of the plumbing system, ensuring smooth flow.
meanings.sent4: The cleanouts acted as silent heroes, keeping the pipes clear and free.
meanings.sent5: The cleanouts were the unsung champions of the plumbing network.

meanings.definition: A thorough cleaning or organization of a space or area.
meanings.sent1: The annual cleanouts of the office were always a team effort.
meanings.sent2: She felt a sense of accomplishment after completing the cleanouts of her room.
meanings.sent3: The cleanouts turned the chaotic room into a peaceful sanctuary.
meanings.sent4: The cleanouts transformed the cluttered space into a haven of order.
meanings.sent5: The cleanouts brought a fresh start to the once messy area.
